originalText.text: Do yourself a favor and take your money to another school. This review is your sign to NOT go here! Listen to me good donâ€™t come to this school! This school is the worst! The environment is hostile! The rules are unnecessary and uptight ! You can go to another school and have a better experience. Most of The teachers are so rude! Honestly just rude and so is most of the staff. Imagine a rude teacher that doesnâ€™t even know how to do what they teaching you! If you think you donâ€™t care and want a detailed education thatâ€™s still not this school! They should honestly be shut down!!! They only care about you doing guest hair and making money for them. There is no makeup hours at this school so god forbid you get sick or have anything going on , you will have all those hours added on at the end. The kits they give you are not worth the price and most things are already broken! My whole class had broken clippers that were never used, and they didnâ€™t give us new ones or give us our money back. Then some of the items given in the kit are not state board approved! So you have to go and spend more money to get the right items to take your board. The late policy at this school is also trash. If you one minute late they sending you home! So letâ€™s say the trains had a delay or something happen they donâ€™t care they will send you home! Please just do yourself a favor and pick another school! You will hate your life if you come to this institution! I could keep going about how terrible this school is but Iâ€™m gonna just end it here but trust i could keep going !

originalText.text: I got a haircut by a student here a month ago. It took three hours, but itâ€™s one of the best haircuts Iâ€™ve had in years, growing out very well, and for $40 including tip? Iâ€™ll be back. You must know going in that it could take 3+ hours. Everything is supervised, so no need to worry. Thank you!

originalText.text:
So, lemme tell you...I just got a great facial with amazing products at an incredible bargain price...on Spring Street! ðŸ˜¯ One of the greatest bargains in NYC is most definitely to be discovered at the Aveda Institute in SOHO!

From the beautifully fragranced, cruelty free, plant based products to the always charming, problem solving, warm and welcoming manager Pamela...(such an asset to this brand and location, btw...)and always, ALL of her oodles of customer service, this place is a gem in the city. The budding and blossoming students and their emerging skill sets, I just love this place!! If you have never, it's time to check out their products and services. Highly recommended, and if you love some bang for your buck, look no further. Thank you, Aveda!!!!!!

originalText.text:
It's a rainy day and I arrived 20 minutes early and they told me the appointment was cancelled. They said that they called me at 2 hours ago and leaved voice message but I received nothing. I did receive an appointment confirmation message after the time they claimed that they called me. They also didn't provide any apologies or suggested ways of compensation. Wasted $6 of subway ticket for nothing. I did one time haircut here before and the student wasn't good or serious compared to Aveda beauty school in other cities. The percentage of rude employees is also much higher here. I'd prefer QB house for cheap haircut or pay a little bit more for a much better experience at a real hair salon.

To summarize: bad management, bad customer service, mediocre skills

originalText.text: Came here for a 30 min facial for only $25. Had a good and relaxing time. Also bought their hydrating night moisturizer.
